en.plot: An investigation that analyses the patterns of the so-called global kleptocracy founded on extractivism, i.e. the indiscriminate hoarding of natural resources that causes irreversible damage to the ecosystem, and on profits often accumulated illegally and protected within the impenetrable walls of tax havens. The sharp gaze of investigative journalists shows how a small core of plutocrats has taken control of the world, demolishing the principles on which the social contract is based. Despite this, the documentary goes beyond mere cynicism or pessimistic drifts, also telling how anger and frustration, in the face of blatant injustice, can be channelled to bring about real change and try to bring about a genuinely better society.
en.abstract: An investigation that analyses the patterns of the so-called global kleptocracy founded on extractivism, i.e. the indiscriminate hoarding of natural resources that causes irreversible damage to the ecosystem, and on

en.originalTitle: The Letter: a Message for Our Earth
en.plot: In his Encyclical Letter Laudato Si' Pope Francis addresses the issue of the environment with unprecedented concern and incisiveness. The denunciation of the impact that human irresponsibility has on the Planet is addressed to every single inhabitant of the world. Four representatives of those ‘voices’ that too often go unheard at international conferences on the global crisis respond to the issues raised, in an exclusive dialogue with the pontiff: a young Senegalese refugee - voice of the Poor, an Amazonian Indian leader - voice of the Indigenous, an Indian climate activist - voice of the Young, a couple of US scientists - voice of Nature. An exciting and necessary journey, in which we are all called upon to be custodians of this common home of ours.
en.abstract: In his Encyclical Letter Laudato Si' Pope Francis addresses the issue of the environment with unprecedented concern and incisiveness. The denunciation of the impact that human irresponsibility has on the

en.plot: WWF Italy's first exploratory mission to the Arctic Ocean. On board the Quick Silver boat, a group of seven experts including marine biologists, mountain guides and naturalists, follow the wild east coast of Greenland to experience first-hand one of the places most affected by climate change. The journey, narrated by Isabella Pratesi, director of WWF Italy's conservation programme, not only shows the beauty of still unspoilt landscapes, but also illustrates, through testimonies and interviews with ESA experts, how the progressive disappearance of ice is upsetting the balance of the Planet's ecosystems, affecting the lives of us all. A fundamental contribution to understanding that the climate crisis must be tackled with awareness, with an intelligent use of technology and, above all, with the will to act.
en.abstract: WWF Italy's first exploratory mission to the Arctic Ocean. On board the Quick Silver boat, a group of seven experts including marine biologists, mountain guides and naturalists, follow the wild

en.plot: Ivan Di Palma, a philosophy graduate, chooses to return to his homeland in Atena Lucana, in the Cilento, Alburni and Vallo di Diano National Park, to dedicate himself to sowing the ‘grains of the future’. Together with the community that has gathered around him, Ivan resists fatigue and becomes a farmer, rediscovering the thread that unites him to the experience of his ancestors. Teresa Vallone, on the other hand, is an old farmer who decides to emigrate to Germany in the 1950s, abandoning the countryside to improve her children's living conditions. Two different generations, two stories that alternate and intertwine as they follow the cycle of the seasons and the life of a grain of wheat, from sowing to harvesting, questioning themselves on the past, the present but above all on the future of the land to leave to their children.
en.abstract: Ivan Di Palma, a philosophy graduate, chooses to return to his homeland in Atena Lucana, in the Cilento, Alburni and Vallo di Diano National Park, to dedicate himself to sowing

en.plot: On the outskirts of Taranto, selected in the 1960s by Pasolini for The Gospel according to St. Matthew and now dominated by large industrial complexes, flows the river Tara, whose waters, once believed to have thaumaturgic powers, are now muddied by Ilva pollution. In the face of this painful reality, however, the story focuses on the people who continue to frequent the area, their stories and their words, their gatherings and their dreams. Men and women of all ages who seem to live in a dimension outside of time and history. Together they compose a complex social portrait, outlining, at the same time, a picture of the whole city and the changes that have passed through it over the decades.
en.abstract: On the outskirts of Taranto, selected in the 1960s by Pasolini for The Gospel according to St. Matthew and now dominated by large industrial complexes, flows the river Tara, whose

en.plot: Michele and Maria, having dedicated their lives to the countryside, reflect on the present. Centuries-old trees are waning, the weather is increasingly unpredictable, and the ripe olives seem destined to remain on the ground. No one takes care of the fields any more, as the two elderly men would like to and, in part, continue to do. At the threshold of ninety, they look at what they have built with sacrifice and satisfaction, wondering about the fate of a world that now seems to belong to a distant past.
en.abstract: Michele and Maria, having dedicated their lives to the countryside, reflect on the present. Centuries-old trees are waning, the weather is increasingly unpredictable, and the ripe olives seem destined to

en.originalTitle: Seed Boom - Eco Guerrilla to Climate Change
en.plot: Created within the framework of NutriAid International's Mindchangers, a project aimed at raising awareness among young people on the issues of the climate crisis, the documentary takes us to Senegal, in an exploration of how, in its economic, historical and social specificity, this country is dealing with the causes and risks of global warming. Through encounters with young activists, farmers and fishermen, accustomed to coming to terms with the effects of soil and resource exploitation, illegal dumping and much more, a vision of the present and future emerges whereby the need for balance between humans and nature is translated into daily action, imposing itself as the only concrete drive towards change.
en.abstract: Created within the framework of NutriAid International's Mindchangers, a project aimed at raising awareness among young people on the issues of the climate crisis, the documentary takes us to Senegal,

en.plot:
From the Taro River to its confluence with the Po, all the way to the sea: a journey along the waters of the Great River, its banks and the villages thinned out on its banks, through a seemingly monotonous, yet ever-changing landscape. Witness today of those who do not seek a lost Eden or a troubled and virtuous past, but simply a glimpse of everyday life, interwoven with lived stories, in a place at once near and remote. The narrative thread of images follows the thoughts of the protagonists who, with voiceover, tell about themselves and their need to experience territories where nature still offers unthinkable wild spaces, resulting in a portrait that shows the contradictions of the present.
The film is made under the patronage of WWF Rovigo and Legambiente Aironi del Po.
en.abstract: From the Taro River to its confluence with the Po, all the way to the sea: a journey along the waters of the Great River, its banks and the villages

en.plot: Sable Island is a tiny island in the North Atlantic off the coast of Nova Scotia. It has a diversity of flora and fauna and is home to Zoe Lucas, researcher, environmentalist, and sole permanent resident for the past 40 years. Her mission is to study the island’s animal and plant species and conserve the delicate balance that regulates this unique habitat, increasingly threatened by the garbage washed up on the sandy shore. This experimental documentary was filmed in 16 mm by innovative techniques that evoke the invisible bond between Lucas and her surroundings.
en.abstract: Sable Island is a tiny island in the North Atlantic off the coast of Nova Scotia. It has a diversity of flora and fauna and is home to Zoe Lucas,

en.plot: How do you cross a natural territory redefined by a century of excavations? From the summit of Monte Magnodeno one can see three quarries cutting through the mountain. The landscape is steep but welcoming, accompanied by a constant, intrusive noise. A man-made place; human bodies walk through it in silence. A slow proceeding, symbol of a humanity that modifies history, but is also capable of remembering it.
en.abstract: How do you cross a natural territory redefined by a century of excavations? From the summit of Monte Magnodeno one can see three quarries cutting through the mountain. The landscape

en.plot: Franco ‘Chief’ Carling, a former US Army officer, is hiding in the dense woods of the Alps, amidst the indelible traces of past world conflicts. He is on the run from someone or perhaps on a mission. From a spiral of memories, suggestions, reality and madness, the anguish of the atomic risk powerfully emerges, a risk that has traversed the history of the last seventy years and that today has lost its strongest controller, the deterrence that was born of the world divided into blocs. In an imaginary and science-fiction narrative framework, strong at the same time as a rigorous historical reconstruction, the reason why the protagonist spends his life in isolation is revealed, while his pain becomes a metaphor for an eternal question that seems to find no way out: a palpable and daily sword of Damocles hanging over humanity.
en.abstract: Franco ‘Chief’ Carling, a former US Army officer, is hiding in the dense woods of the Alps, amidst the indelible traces of past world conflicts. He is on the run

en.plot: An incredible survey conducted in Turkey reveals how the western world, the European Union in the first place, not excluding Italy, is flooding the most fragile areas of the Earth with its plastic or non-recyclable waste, heedless of the environmental disaster that will affect everyone indiscriminately and whose consequences are already clearly perceptible. The overabundance of disposable plastic, in fact, despite institutional announcements promising to reduce its production, seems destined to triple its devastating impact in the coming decades. The message is unmistakable: there is only one ecosystem, if we continue to act thinking we are ‘only’ contaminating remote agricultural land, the vicious circle in which we are currently trapped will never be broken.
en.abstract: An incredible survey conducted in Turkey reveals how the western world, the European Union in the first place, not excluding Italy, is flooding the most fragile areas of the Earth

en.plot: A passionate account of Piero Gilardi's artistic and human experience. A tribute to an extraordinary representative of world contemporary art, which today, a few months after his death, becomes even more precious. The sculptor of the Tappeti Natura (Nature Carpets), the founder of the Parco Arte Vivente (Living Art Park) in Turin, who from the very beginning of his career placed the relationship between art, man and nature at the centre of his research, is portrayed here in his essence as a ‘master’, understood as his ability to transmit his art to others with generous simplicity. On the basis of these considerations, the director's desire to dedicate a documentary to Gilardi was born in the 1980s, an idea that matured over time and was realised on the occasion of the 1 May 2018 celebrations, where he is still present in militant performance actions, busy directing his foam rubber creatures.
en.abstract: A passionate account of Piero Gilardi's artistic and human experience. A tribute to an extraordinary representative of world contemporary art, which today, a few months after his death, becomes even

en.plot: On the island of Réunion lies the Cirque de Mafate, a depression of volcanic origin surrounded by high walls, hidden in the heart of the National Park and accessible only on foot, via a long route, or by helicopter. Populated by a small community of farmers descended from the Maroons, the slaves who fled the French colonisers, Aurère - meaning ‘good land’ - is one of the villages in this natural site. In a unique dimension of rural life, nature sets its own rhythm and the people organically adapt to it. Thus emerges the story of the relationship between past and present, the story of a conquered freedom, today endangered by the climatic threat that seems to bring with it the echo of a past in which hopes and anger merge.
en.abstract: On the island of Réunion lies the Cirque de Mafate, a depression of volcanic origin surrounded by high walls, hidden in the heart of the National Park and accessible only

en.originalTitle: L’ombra del fuoco - S’umbra ‘e su fogu
en.plot: In July 2021, in Sardinia, a terrible fire suddenly bursts out, devastating the vast Montiferru area in the Oristanese region: an entire ecosystem is destroyed, centuries-old woods and olive groves are reduced to ashes, and the thousand-year-old olive tree of ‘Sa tanca manna’ is damaged forever. After the disaster, the economy of the place is disrupted, as people wander the disfigured landscape as if they were ghosts, searching for a memory of which they can no longer find a trace; the trees will not return, everything is irretrievably lost. Yet in the midst of that desolation, the song of cicadas is heard unexpectedly. A small troupe follows the fire seasons for a year, listens to the voices of the local population, shares their songs, rituals and pain, gradually witnessing the miracle of nature being reborn.
en.abstract: In July 2021, in Sardinia, a terrible fire suddenly bursts out, devastating the vast Montiferru area in the Oristanese region: an entire ecosystem is destroyed, centuries-old woods and olive groves

en.plot: A year of observing one of the highest cable cars in the world, located on the Italian side of the Mont Blanc massif. A place where the installation, its users and those who work there intersect, constituting the main actors of a spectacle designed to overcome the limits of nature. As time goes by, the landscape changes continuously, each image created is extreme and spectacular; visitors follow one another and many try to capture that astonishment with a photographic shot, in which, more often than not, the mountain is relegated to a mere background. A portrait of a daily routine is gradually composed, through which the film explores the relationship between technology, tourism and mountaineering, modernity and natural environments, representation and experience.
en.abstract: A year of observing one of the highest cable cars in the world, located on the Italian side of the Mont Blanc massif. A place where the installation, its users

en.plot: The story of a journey across Italy to discover national, natural and regional parks with their unique and evocative environments. Born from an idea by Gian Luca Gasca, journalist and mountaineer, the documentary follows the line of the Sentiero Italia CAI, the hiking itinerary that, with its 7850 km, embraces the entire country, crossing the Alps, the Apennines and the two largest islands, Sicily and Sardinia. It is Gian Luca himself who walks it, conveying not only his passion, but also the importance of the opportunity, supported from the beginning by the creators of the project, to combine the stages of the trail with the use of public transport: a tool to make trekking even more environmentally sustainable and prevent the abandonment of many mountainous areas in our territory.
en.abstract: The story of a journey across Italy to discover national, natural and regional parks with their unique and evocative environments. Born from an idea by Gian Luca Gasca, journalist and

en.plot: A tribute to Cocito & Pastore's production company Legovideo, active in Turin between 1984 and 2022. Conceived as a triptych in split screen, the documentary re-proposes material shot and edited at the time in U-MATIC/ BVU, a format used by the studio over a period of time ranging from its foundation to the early 1990s. This film project is part of a broader research project to recover and re-elaborate video memory, which the director has been conducting for some time in synergy with the Associazione Museo Nazionale del Cinema (AMNC). Through the panoramas and long shots of the precious footage of the famous Intervalli italiani (1989 - 1992), the changing times and landscapes are thus restored, which from the Turin suburbs gradually spread to the whole of Italy, in an ideal journey through space that becomes the memory of time.
en.abstract: A tribute to Cocito & Pastore's production company Legovideo, active in Turin between 1984 and 2022. Conceived as a triptych in split screen, the documentary re-proposes material shot and edited

en.plot: A city risen from the water, a unique world of hidden realities, and a mysterious narrator voice that seems to come from a distant future. Inspired by Italo Calvino's Invisible Cities, the kaleidoscopic tale of the last years experienced by the city of Venice unfolds. The life of toil and prostration of fishermen, the increasingly frequent floods, the lockdown following the pandemic, and then the devastating impact of mass tourism and the consequences of human activity on the natural ecosystem. Amidst legends, rituals and hearsay, the soul of an extraordinary city emerges, with its everyday life made up of boats, its animals and its evanescent islands, but which, paradoxically, becomes a synthesis and representation of the difficulties and contradictions that the world's metropolises face today.
en.abstract: A city risen from the water, a unique world of hidden realities, and a mysterious narrator voice that seems to come from a distant future. Inspired by Italo Calvino's Invisible

en.originalTitle: Io, Tevere - Le radici del mare
en.localizedTitle: I, Tiber - The roots of the sea
en.plot: A journey, in apparently light-hearted tones, to rediscover the forgotten beauty of the Tiber, its millenary history and ecosystems. The denunciation of wicked interventions and the carelessness of the community that have led it to its current state of unacceptable degradation. The two protagonists, Marco Spinelli, documentary filmmaker, and Roberto D'Amico, Italian surfing champion and activist, traverse it, observe it, celebrate it, and collect the testimonies and teachings of the people who inhabit it on a daily basis. A true act of love, a metaphor for the necessary friendship and cooperation between man and nature. The film was made as part of the Tiber Project, an initiative aimed at raising awareness among institutions and citizens for actions to restore this river.
en.abstract: A journey, in apparently light-hearted tones, to rediscover the forgotten beauty of the Tiber, its millenary history and ecosystems. The denunciation of wicked interventions and the carelessness of the community

en.plot: On the border between Piedmont and Liguria, among the slopes of the Mongia Valley, an entire ecosystem survives unchanged. This is the natural space of the chestnut grove, a metaphor of integration between man and the environment. A unique heritage of knowledge handed down from generation to generation. Punctuated by the changing of the seasons and the arrival of the ‘castagnere’ for the harvest, chestnut cultivation has been transformed into culture, shaping an otherwise wild and poor territory. Ettore Bozzolo is one of the last custodians of this centuries-old tradition, recounted in the documentary since April 2000, when he himself gave a camera to his son Sandro so that he could film the pruning of the large tree at the centre of the forest. Over twenty years of life, in which grafting, in giving the plants new sap, is the red thread of a world reborn from the severed trunk of a past that is still alive.
en.abstract: On the border between Piedmont and Liguria, among the slopes of the Mongia Valley, an entire ecosystem survives unchanged. This is the natural space of the chestnut grove, a metaphor

en.plot: Through the figure of trade unionist Franco Sartori (1941-1996), the story of Genoa in the last twenty years of the last century: a capital city hit by the crisis of the large factories and the port, marked by pollution and the absence of industrial policies. It was in this context that new political subjects emerged, such as the Women's Health and Environment Committee of Cornigliano, and personalities like Sartori, the man who saw in Genoa's Ponente area an opportunity to start to imagine and build a new season of urban development in such a complex area. Interviews, archive footage and unpublished images tell us about his ‘possible city’, the one that does not consume the territory but, on the contrary, invests in an idea of life driven by the need for true sustainability.
en.abstract: Through the figure of trade unionist Franco Sartori (1941-1996), the story of Genoa in the last twenty years of the last century: a capital city hit by the crisis of

en.plot: Throughout the Italian peninsula, simple citizens, in their desire not to stand still and wait for things to change, decide to turn themselves into guerrilla gardeners: unauthorised, they clean up and redevelop entire urban areas left to neglect or forgotten by local administrations. Inspired by the non-violent Guerrilla Gardening movement, born in New York in the 1970s, the solitary Fante di Fiori and Piante Volanti, or organised groups such as Friarielli Ribelli, Giardiniere Sovversive Romane, Terra di Nettuno or Ammazza che Piazza, already boast a long history of battles fought with the only possible weapons, plants and flowers. United in a national network, these new urban heroes tell their stories, reminding us how planting a seed today is a revolutionary act.
en.abstract: Throughout the Italian peninsula, simple citizens, in their desire not to stand still and wait for things to change, decide to turn themselves into guerrilla gardeners: unauthorised, they clean up

en.originalTitle: Il fiume per noi. La vita che scorre
en.localizedTitle: The river for us. Flowing life
en.plot: The movie is concerned with the peculiarities and criticalities that the river Po presents as it flows through the urban section of the city of Turin. A story that is articulated both ‘from inside’ the river and ‘from its banks’, meeting and involving some of the actors who make daily use of this resource or who work in close contact with it. An extraordinary wealth, too often underestimated and damaged by the unconscious hand of man.
en.abstract: The movie is concerned with the peculiarities and criticalities that the river Po presents as it flows through the urban section of the city of Turin. A story that is

en.originalTitle: Dove l’uomo non è più sovrano
en.localizedTitle: Where man is no longer sovereign
en.plot: The Apennines of the Four Provinces. Since the inhabitants abandoned these mountains, nature has taken back the spaces that had been stolen from her: beeches, hornbeams and oaks cover the most inaccessible areas, martens and wildcats live in the reforested chestnut groves. In the eyes of civilised man, these places may seem neglected and lifeless. In reality, in the shade of those large trees, there is a new generation of animals, including foxes and wolves, that is learning the primordial rules for surviving as long as possible in the wild.
en.abstract: The Apennines of the Four Provinces. Since the inhabitants abandoned these mountains, nature has taken back the spaces that had been stolen from her: beeches, hornbeams and oaks cover the

en.plot: Lourdes and her family live in the Peruvian city of Cerro de Pasco, just a few metres from the enormous lead mine that for years has heavily contaminated the environment there, one of the most polluted on the planet. Her two children, in particular, suffer from serious pathologies caused by heavy metal poisoning, with serious consequences on their life expectancy. Unfortunately, the need to take them away from that place that is killing them clashes with the social and economic impossibility of imagining a future elsewhere.
en.abstract: Lourdes and her family live in the Peruvian city of Cerro de Pasco, just a few metres from the enormous lead mine that for years has heavily contaminated the environment

en.plot: On the Sicilian shore of the Strait of Messina, the sea, in its being a boundary line, dominates, as if it takes over the passage of time and the destiny of those who pass through it. While the winter months, as usual, are lived in anticipation of the summer season, Michele and Antonio repair their felucca in anticipation of swordfish fishing and Pippo weaves the creels that he will lower into the strait from May to September. They all live waiting for the right current, the right season. A thousand-year wait that chains them to that liquid body on which their lives sail.
en.abstract: On the Sicilian shore of the Strait of Messina, the sea, in its being a boundary line, dominates, as if it takes over the passage of time and the destiny

en.localizedTitle: At the roots of the sky
en.plot: Oreste's Hutte, an alpine hut located at an altitude of 2600 metres, is unique in its kind: open even in winter, it is run by the Squinobal family, who have chosen to experience the mountains in a different way in order to respect the natural habitat that surrounds them as much as possible. Through the reconstruction of the history of the refuge, we get to know the lives of the brothers Arturo and Oreste, two great figures linked to the mountains who, with their exploits from the Aosta Valley to Nepal, wrote some of the most interesting pages of mountaineering. Today, in this place, in a multi-generational dimension, we intertwine the stories of the families who live there and who contribute to making it special, in full awareness of the risks that human beings themselves are causing to the environment.
en.abstract: Oreste's Hutte, an alpine hut located at an altitude of 2600 metres, is unique in its kind: open even in winter, it is run by the Squinobal family, who have

en.plot: The story of the transition from heavy industry, which characterized production in the 19th and 20th centuries, to logistics managed by digital systems, seen through the history of the Ferriera: Trieste's famous steel plant, closed after 123 years and numerous changes of ownership. Because of its role in the local economy and society, the factory in the Julian capital is a symbol, but not a unique example. Bytes, containers, white collars and silence replace fire, dust, sweat and crashes, telling us not only about an urban transformation leading toward sustainability and the conversion of metallurgy into clean energy, but also about social changes related to the effort to adapt contexts to new, cleaner though perhaps more anonymous forms of production.
en.abstract: The story of the transition from heavy industry, which characterized production in the 19th and 20th centuries, to logistics managed by digital systems, seen through the history of the Ferriera:

en.plot: In recent years, the demand for pork has increased dramatically in China. This has led to the proliferation of intensive livestock farms, whose factories, seen from the outside, resemble anything but farms, raising many doubts about their sustainability. At the same time, a Food Valley in Netherlands, widely referred to as "the Silicon Valley of food", has been conducting fruitful research on plant-based meat, establishing itself as one of the largest agribusiness hubs in Europe. Two examples of how the race for profit has led to the transformation of the food industry on a global scale. A drift with a dystopian flavor, whose risks might not yet be clear to us, but which, worryingly, is beginning to show the inevitable negative impact on our planet.
en.abstract: In recent years, the demand for pork has increased dramatically in China. This has led to the proliferation of intensive livestock farms, whose factories, seen from the outside, resemble anything

en.plot: The film investigates the impact of fluorite deposits, production, and the industrial use of fluoride on environmental and human health. The journey starts the at Silius mines in Sardinia, then Veneto, and finally the Peak District National Park, Derbyshire, U.K. Testimony and expert accounts relate past environmental disasters, living with the consequences unknown to local populations, the strategies to protect the economic interests of the few against those of the community. Though the damage is irreversible, gradual awareness raising in local communities is key to revealing the truth.
en.abstract: The film investigates the impact of fluorite deposits, production, and the industrial use of fluoride on environmental and human health. The journey starts the at Silius mines in Sardinia, then

en.plot: From the Zug Island production complex, located on the US-Canadian border, comes a mysterious hum known as ‘Windsor Hum’. In search of the source of this strange acoustic emission, a sound technician sets off and meets several people forced to come to terms with decades of uncontrolled industrial devastation. An investigation into the theme of ecocide perpetrated in an age of unbridled capitalism is conducted in a language that combines the cinema-truth, investigative documentary and poetic essay.
en.abstract: From the Zug Island production complex, located on the US-Canadian border, comes a mysterious hum known as ‘Windsor Hum’. In search of the source of this strange acoustic emission, a

en.plot: Since ancient times, countless ways and means have been used to transport water, the essential element for life. From a village in Peru, the story of one of the last morropenses, the men who traditionally travelled long distances carrying huge jerrycans of water on their horses. But how much longer will the leap towards modernity be inevitable?
en.abstract: Since ancient times, countless ways and means have been used to transport water, the essential element for life. From a village in Peru, the story of one of the last

en.plot: In a small town in Ghana, on the edge of a large dump that spills into the ocean, a fisherman's sons, Sowah and Okai, struggle to cope with the loss of their older brother, who disappeared during an offshore fishing trip. In his grief, Okai struggles with an obsession: according to Ghanaian culture, the spirit of those who drown at sea is condemned to wander in search of their home.
en.abstract: In a small town in Ghana, on the edge of a large dump that spills into the ocean, a fisherman's sons, Sowah and Okai, struggle to cope with the loss

en.plot: A poetic and subtly humorous journey on the trail of the multiple destinies of wood. The movie blends stop motion animation, real and experimental images, to stage a composition of objects and landscapes, through which an old puppet finds his place in the world.
en.abstract: A poetic and subtly humorous journey on the trail of the multiple destinies of wood. The movie blends stop motion animation, real and experimental images, to stage a composition of

en.plot: The rapid rise and fall of the Bacchus Marsh Lion Safari, established on the outskirts of Melbourne in 1970 and forced to close in the mid-1980s due to several fatalities caused by lion attacks on visitors. Long shrouded in mystery, this place is now recounted to us through the figure of Ron ‘Prenda’ Prendergast, the director's father, then a young feline keeper and a direct witness to a part of local history that has become almost legend.
en.abstract: The rapid rise and fall of the Bacchus Marsh Lion Safari, established on the outskirts of Melbourne in 1970 and forced to close in the mid-1980s due to several fatalities

en.plot: On a stormy night in early 2021, the body of a whale washed up on the beach at Nitzanim, Israel. The documentation of the discovery of the carcass and the observation of the first contact with it by the locals alternate with interviews of some direct witnesses of the extraordinary event and images of the work of the scientists gathered around the animal. The story of a collective experience, which gradually turns into the eternal dialogue between life and death.
en.abstract: On a stormy night in early 2021, the body of a whale washed up on the beach at Nitzanim, Israel. The documentation of the discovery of the carcass and the

en.plot: Two fishermen find a dolphin accidentally entangled in their nets and they try to rescue it. The dolphin, in turn, tries to save a fisherman who is drowning in the water. In a small corner of the Mediterranean sea, the ancient myth from the Greek island of Samos and the myth from the Arctic Circle unexpectedly meet. Mythology blends with reality, while physical theatre merges with cinema through the narration of the actors and the universal language of the body.
en.abstract: Two fishermen find a dolphin accidentally entangled in their nets and they try to rescue it. The dolphin, in turn, tries to save a fisherman who is drowning in the

en.plot: In order to be granted asylum, a climate refugee must undergo an interview with a state examiner. Forced to prove the veracity of his journey and the legitimacy of his claim, the man recalls the stages of his crossing, characterised by adverse conditions and the hardships he survived. The tale causes him to relive the trauma and test his emotional strength. A powerful reflection that combines the theme of climate change with that of immigration and exile.
en.abstract: In order to be granted asylum, a climate refugee must undergo an interview with a state examiner. Forced to prove the veracity of his journey and the legitimacy of his

en.plot: Equipped with binoculars and a notebook, an explorer traverses the jungles of Borneo. He moves at dusk and nightfall in search of orangutans. He contemplates them, studies them, draws them. Two stories are evoked during his search: a fable from the System of Nature by Carlo Linneo and the testimony of the keeper of the Ménagerie at the Jardin des Plantes. A dreamlike and fascinating meditation on the strange symbiotic relationship that has developed between humans and primates over the centuries.
en.abstract: Equipped with binoculars and a notebook, an explorer traverses the jungles of Borneo. He moves at dusk and nightfall in search of orangutans. He contemplates them, studies them, draws them.

en.plot: An astronaut emerges from the wreckage of his spaceship in the volcanic crater of Mount Nyiragongo. As he descends into the city below, he encounters the people of present-day Goma, an event that leads him to understand how to change the future of that place. Driven by the search for a true home, his own identity and values that could represent him, the protagonist will turn his exploration into a profound inner monologue.
en.abstract: An astronaut emerges from the wreckage of his spaceship in the volcanic crater of Mount Nyiragongo. As he descends into the city below, he encounters the people of present-day Goma,

en.originalTitle: Los órganos internos de la Madre Tierra
en.plot: The movie is an experimental work, a backward journey, that follows the acrid smell of coal from the port of Amsterdam to its origin: an open wound in the north of Colombia, a mine with a devastating impact on the territory and on the Wayuu indigenous community that inhabits it and that has an ancestral and healing bond with ‘Mma’, Mother Earth, considered unique and sacred. Through the mixture of different narrative styles, the movie is an evocative visual reflection on the meaning and contradictions of mining.
en.abstract: The movie is an experimental work, a backward journey, that follows the acrid smell of coal from the port of Amsterdam to its origin: an open wound in the north

en.plot: A house built at dizzying height on the steep face of a mountain. From there, every day, a father and his son parachute down to the distant valley to sell the ice they produce. Family relationships and climate change intertwine to tell the story of the inner crisis of all humanity.

en.plot: In an Indian village, a teenage worker, finding a baby calf grazing amidst polythene bags, decides to entrust it to a local shelter run by Hindu volunteers committed to protecting the sacred cow and curbing beef consumption. Fascinated by the self-sacrifice of this group of new activists, the young man decides to join them. Halfway between documentary and fiction, a look at contemporary India, its contradictions and a system that promotes exploitation as currency.
en.abstract: In an Indian village, a teenage worker, finding a baby calf grazing amidst polythene bags, decides to entrust it to a local shelter run by Hindu volunteers committed to protecting

en.plot: On 14 July 2021, a natural disaster occurs in the Ahr Valley in the Rhineland region, claiming more than one hundred and thirty victims. Ahrweiler in particular now appears as a ghost town, according to the best vision of a dystopian tale. For Abdo, this is not the first disaster: born and raised in Aleppo, he shares the pain of loss, forced to relive the feeling of fear and helplessness.

en.plot: Through the words and the off-screen gaze of an architect, a small film-essay that starts from the city of Dhaka, victim of savage urbanisation processes, and expands to the surrounding countryside, including its inhabitants and landscapes. The result is a melancholic elegy celebrating nostalgia for the traditions of rural culture set against the metropolitan chaos of the present.
en.abstract: Through the words and the off-screen gaze of an architect, a small film-essay that starts from the city of Dhaka, victim of savage urbanisation processes, and expands to the surrounding

en.plot: On the Vosges mountain range, night gradually falls and the forests become secret. In the twilight the shadows come to life and it is then that every small movement, every tiny sound expands to overpower its surroundings. The massive bodies of the animals pulse, breathe, their muscles stiffen, their fur stands up, while guttural cries resound until dawn. A sensory immersion at the limits of a universe as fascinating as it is mysterious.
en.abstract: On the Vosges mountain range, night gradually falls and the forests become secret. In the twilight the shadows come to life and it is then that every small movement, every

en.plot: Brooklyn's Gowanus Canal, polluted by more than a century of industrial activity, is one of the most contaminated bodies of water in the United States. Amidst evocative patches of floating colour, on the surface and in the bottom, the director follows the start of drainage operations promoted by the Environmental Protection Agency, which over the next ten years, it is estimated, will remove a mixture of toxic sediments including tar, chemical waste and heavy metals.
en.abstract: Brooklyn's Gowanus Canal, polluted by more than a century of industrial activity, is one of the most contaminated bodies of water in the United States. Amidst evocative patches of floating

en.plot: Through scenes of everyday life and deeply evocative images, the story unfolds the life of the indigenous Guaraní people, inhabitants of the village of Poha Renda, on the border between Brazil and Paraguay. Their peasant traditions, their cosmic spiritualism and their love for the land and nature are threatened by the extensive monocultures surrounding the area and the armed patrols stationed nearby. One day, however, during the Nhemongarai ritual, the village shaman receives a message from the creator god Nhanderu, which contains a good omen for the future.
en.abstract: Through scenes of everyday life and deeply evocative images, the story unfolds the life of the indigenous Guaraní people, inhabitants of the village of Poha Renda, on the border between

en.plot: Exploration of life in the Salzburg zoo during the spring 2020 lockdown. An essential and minimalist narrative, accompanied only by a constant soundtrack, in which the camera scrutinises the activity of animals immersed in an almost unreal dimension, in suspended time, far from the hubbub and prying gaze of visitors. Monkeys, flamingoes, crocodiles, rhinoceroses, piranhas: all of them take part in an absurd and unpredictable situation that seems straight out of a dystopian science fiction story. Observing this glimpse of reality, however, the spectator is prompted to reflect on the condition of seclusion and captivity in which this fauna is forced to live, imprisoned in spaces that are too confined and far removed from natural environments.
en.abstract: Exploration of life in the Salzburg zoo during the spring 2020 lockdown. An essential and minimalist narrative, accompanied only by a constant soundtrack, in which the camera scrutinises the activity

en.plot: The story of four young women who with great determination are leading the fight for the Green New Deal, a bold policy initiative programme aimed at curbing the consequences of climate change and making racial and economic justice part of the solution. Democratic Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Varshini Prakash of Sunrise Moviment, Alexandra Rojas of Justice Democrats and writer Rhiana Gunn-Wright, forced to come to terms with cynicism, disinterest and uncertainty, including those generated by the pandemic, are filmed on public occasions but also in their daily lives, sometimes busy dealing with the long bureaucratic travails that stifle any attempt at renewal. From street protests to the halls of Congress, a new narrative emerges, revealing the crisis as an opportunity to build a better society.
en.abstract: The story of four young women who with great determination are leading the fight for the Green New Deal, a bold policy initiative programme aimed at curbing the consequences of

en.originalTitle: Le Système Total, anatomie d’une multinationale de l’énergie
en.localizedTitle: The Total System, anatomy of a multinational energy company
en.plot: In 2021, TOTAL, one of the world's five largest oil companies, changes its name to Total Energies and announces a new business project oriented towards the energy transition, arousing widespread perplexity. Numerous interviews with scientists and researchers show, in fact, the unreliability of this change, as also shown by the activities that the industrial giant carries out in different parts of the world such as Texas, Uganda or the Gulf of Mexico. Moreover, acting as a counterpoint to the opinions of experts and analysts is the activity of men and women who are fighting against the multinational corporation's lies and in favour of citizens' rights and environmental protection: an effort that increasingly seems to resemble an updating of the David versus Goliath struggle.
en.abstract: In 2021, TOTAL, one of the world's five largest oil companies, changes its name to Total Energies and announces a new business project oriented towards the energy transition, arousing widespread

en.plot: Through hypnotic images, accompanied by an evocative soundtrack, the exploration of the daily travails of the inhabitants of the Siberian village of Šologon, located in the heart of the taiga within one of the Russian government's demarcated "zones," remote areas that are difficult to access, sparsely inhabited and, in this case, constantly threatened by fires. In 2021, abandoned by authorities and institutions, the local population is forced to deal with an abnormal heat wave and the consequent eruption of huge fires, witnessing the devastation of millions of hectares of land, both from the rush of the flames and the scattering of ashes. Thus emerges a profound reflection on the relationship between man and nature, where an almost mystical and religious respect for the elements is joined by fear of their destructive power.
en.abstract: Through hypnotic images, accompanied by an evocative soundtrack, the exploration of the daily travails of the inhabitants of the Siberian village of Šologon, located in the heart of the taiga

en.plot: In France, thousands of people work in the nuclear industry for subcontractors. To perform maintenance work, many of them travel from one nuclear power plant to another, moving like nomads in caravans that have become their homes. Young people especially respond to the lure of a great salary, with the idea that they can earn good money in the shortest possible time. Thus, against the backdrop of a hard and lonely life, Marie-Lou, Florian, Jérôme, and Vincent share a common dream of a different future, with property, children, and guaranteed wealth. Driven by these goals, they keep moving through the different power plants, saving every penny and obtaining wage premiums, at the price, however, of constant exposure to massive doses of radioactivity.
en.abstract: In France, thousands of people work in the nuclear industry for subcontractors. To perform maintenance work, many of them travel from one nuclear power plant to another, moving like nomads

en.plot: A full beard and an inquisitive gaze, Finnish retiree Hannu has exiled himself from civilized society and lives in the woods in close contact with nature and animals. In particular, through the installation of CCTV cameras, Hannu has managed to create a system to monitor the lives of his beloved lynx, whose habitat is in danger of being compromised by human activity. Through the alternation of live color footage and black-and-white surveillance images, the narrative is transformed almost into a hypnotic journey with strong dreamlike connotations while Hannu's thoughts, exposed in front of the camera, testify to us the need to regain that harmony between man and nature that seems now irretrievably lost.
en.abstract: A full beard and an inquisitive gaze, Finnish retiree Hannu has exiled himself from civilized society and lives in the woods in close contact with nature and animals. In particular,

en.plot: Mentioned only among the dark spaces of boardrooms or in intelligence briefings, a new and invisible threat is on the horizon. Aware that by 2030 the demand for fresh water will exceed supply by 40 percent, the world's superpowers are quietly procuring the last remaining water reserves and grabbing the remaining farmland to prepare for future famines destined to trigger devastating conflicts, topple governments and trigger the mass migration of hundreds of millions of people. The documentary follows the investigation into the new, emerging form of land grabbing, coordinated by journalist Nathan Halverson of the Center for Investigative Reporting, a former Emmy Award winner, delivering moments of tension and twists and turns as in the best thrillers.
en.abstract: Mentioned only among the dark spaces of boardrooms or in intelligence briefings, a new and invisible threat is on the horizon. Aware that by 2030 the demand for fresh water

en.plot: An up-to-date account of geopolitical, scientific and corporate intrigue that reveals the background of new international planning, ready to kick off the massive extraction, from the deep seabed, of metals deemed essential for the production of the electric batteries and gases that can provide for the world's energy crisis. Narrated by actor Jason Momoa, the film follows in particular the mining startup The Metals Company, which, having obtained funding and authorization from the relevant international authority, is set to take action in large areas of the Pacific Ocean. In observing these companies engaged in co-opting scientific studies, providing compelling targets to investors, demonstrating infallible benefit to all mankind, it is highlighted how destructive such an industrial model is at the root of which lies the deliberate choice not to develop alternative resources.
en.abstract: An up-to-date account of geopolitical, scientific and corporate intrigue that reveals the background of new international planning, ready to kick off the massive extraction, from the deep seabed, of metals

en.plot: A journey into the recesses of the mind, through seemingly unknown and new, yet familiar, visual landscapes. From the darkness, and the anxieties it can generate, to the vital pulse that animates nature: abstract and mysterious, subtly magical places that surpass human perception and distort it.
en.abstract: A journey into the recesses of the mind, through seemingly unknown and new, yet familiar, visual landscapes. From the darkness, and the anxieties it can generate, to the vital pulse

en.plot: The waterfalls of Monte Gelato, located 50 km from Rome in the Valle del Treja Regional Park, are a unique place, used as a set for hundreds of productions, including art cinema and genre films. This video essay is an evocative 3D collage of images extrapolated from these films.

en.plot: An audiovisual composition between electro-acoustic music and digital art. An exploration that, starting from cultural syncretism, shows us how empathy can also be generated by behaviors related to it.
en.abstract: An audiovisual composition between electro-acoustic music and digital art. An exploration that, starting from cultural syncretism, shows us how empathy can also be generated by behaviors related to it.

en.plot: On his birthday, a cake awaits Marco in the kitchen: it is a surprise Polo has given him. But it also appears that every object in the room has been secured and glued with tape and string... What seemed to be the beginning of a beautiful morning takes an unexpected and dramatic turn.

en.plot: For little Tadeo, the anxiety of wanting to see the newly planted tree in the yard grow quickly will be an opportunity to understand and respect nature's extraordinary timing.
en.abstract: For little Tadeo, the anxiety of wanting to see the newly planted tree in the yard grow quickly will be an opportunity to understand and respect nature's extraordinary timing.

en.plot: A young boy is injured in the woods and is alone. But the ancient animal spirits will not abandon him.
en.abstract: A young boy is injured in the woods and is alone. But the ancient animal spirits will not abandon him.

en.plot: Spring is supposed to be the season of awakening, but among the rape fields that cover the hillside sprouts a lone tree, now dried up. A boy tries to put leaves back on its branches to "give it life," but in the end he decides to keep it alive only in his own heart.

en.plot: The movie tells the melancholy and poetic story of the small polar bear Ursa, who, having found himself alone in the Arctic darkness, faces the toughest challenges of winter in order to find his mother.

en.plot: To the rhythm of a cumbia, the cut-out animation takes shape in a little girl's encounter with the magic of a sustainable world.
en.abstract: To the rhythm of a cumbia, the cut-out animation takes shape in a little girl's encounter with the magic of a sustainable world.

en.plot: An orangutan lives in a cage in the city zoo, dreaming of soaring through the trees. A little girl, whose father contributes to the clearing of forests to increase his own earnings, becomes his friend. But when the orangutan grabs the man's smartphone, the unexpected happens, in a planetary chain reaction.

en.abstract: The film tells the story of the delicate balance between a special family of moon-watchers and the "ups and downs" of their everyday life on a small island.

en.plot: The movies tells the story of a jellyfish helping a manatee injured by a motor boat. A story of solidarity to reflect on the constant dangers that human presence causes to these extraordinary aquatic mammals.

en.plot: Adapted from the science fiction novel Largo! Largo! by Harry Harrison, the film takes us to the decaying New York City of 2022, constantly shrouded in an eerie fog, against the backdrop of an Earth now hopelessly polluted and overpopulated. Suicide is promoted and assisted, food is scarce, and the population, divided into rigid castes, feeds on strange foods produced by the powerful Soylent industry. As a result of their investigation into the murder of an executive of the same company, Detective Thorn and his associate Sol Roth learn a terrible secret about the ingredients used. In every way they will be prevented from divulging the truth, condemning them to an inexorable fate.
en.abstract: Adapted from the science fiction novel Largo! Largo! by Harry Harrison, the film takes us to the decaying New York City of 2022, constantly shrouded in an eerie fog, against

en.plot: Pierre is a young dairy farmer who puts his heart and soul into his land. His love of his job is the pendulum of his life, swinging to his conflictual relationship with his sister, a vet responsible for animal health in the region. The future of the family farm is endangered when a cattle epidemic spreads through France and infects one of its 30 animals. Pierre is subsequently drawn into a whirl of guilt and hope and has to stretch his observance of the law to the limit to save his beloved cattle.
en.abstract: Pierre is a young dairy farmer who puts his heart and soul into his land. His love of his job is the pendulum of his life, swinging to his

en.plot:
Based on the bestseller of the same name by Eric Schlosser, Linklater’s co-writer, Fast Food
Nation is a damning indictment of the Americanfood industry in general and fast-food joints in particular.

Don Anderson (Greg Kinnear), head of marketing for Mickey’s, a popular nationwide fast-food chain, discovers that the meat it puts in its products is off. Determined to discover the truth, he moves from California to Cody, in Colorado, where the animals are butchered. The plant’s clinically sterile exterior conceals a very different, uncomfortable reality: namely that the meat used consists of scraps of very poor quality. That’s not all: the abattoir employs mainly illegal Mexican immigrants, who are subjected to all sorts of impositions and constantly exposed to accident risk.
en.abstract: Based on the bestseller of the same name by Eric Schlosser, Linklater’s co-writer, Fast FoodNation is a damning indictment of the Americanfood industry in general and fast-food joints in

en.plot: The true story of Robert Bilott, the American environmental attorney who led a grueling 19-year legal battle against the chemical colossus DuPont. Tenacious and combative, he represented 70,000 citizens in Ohio and Virginia whose drinking water was contaminated by the unchecked dumping of perfluorooctanoic acid (PFOA). Thanks to a toxicological study of the deceased, Bilott was able to demonstrate the gravity of the contamination and won major settlements for the victims. The affair hit the international headlines in 2016 following the publication of an article in the New York Times.
en.abstract: The true story of Robert Bilott, the American environmental attorney who led a grueling 19-year legal battle against the chemical colossus DuPont. Tenacious and combative, he represented 70,000 citizens in

en.plot: The third installment of the triptych that began with Il pianeta azzurro and continued with Nostos, il ritorno, takes us to the small Mantuan village of Castellaro Lagusello, where the simplicity of feelings and gestures, now almost forgotten, follows through the seasons of life. The games of childhood, the surprises and upsets of adolescence, dances, loves, marriages. The old stand still, watching in listening; in the adults emerges the nostalgia of a receding youth. The hubbub of the inhabitants is intertwined with the everyday noises and intangible sounds of nature, while the light of the landscapes follows its circularity marking the passage of time. The taste of summer evenings, autumn with the light dance of leaves in the wind and, finally, the arrival of snow to mark a new beginning.
en.abstract: The third installment of the triptych that began with Il pianeta azzurro and continued with Nostos, il ritorno, takes us to the small Mantuan village of Castellaro Lagusello, where the

en.plot: A group of actresses gathers on a stage, ready to play the members of a hypothetical female government of a fictional nation. In light of a looming threat from an enemy country that is increasing its nuclear weapons, the government meets in a "Peace Room," as opposed to the "War Room" described in Dr. Strangelove. In deciding how to respond and whether to proceed with plans for unilateral disarmament, the government consults with real-life experts: defense consultants, female soldiers, lawyers, peace activists, human rights activists, and political figures, who gradually join the actresses. Placing real figures in an imaginary context, mixing written jokes and improvisation, the project explores what would happen if the world's countries were led by women.
en.abstract: A group of actresses gathers on a stage, ready to play the members of a hypothetical female government of a fictional nation. In light of a looming threat from an

en.plot: Husband and wife Htwe Tin e Thein Shwe extract oil from a well near their house. Driven by an engine, cables, and gears, the pumping rig is manually controlled, one of the many wells operated in an unregulated oil field in the Magway region of Myanmar. Life is hard; the only compensation is the hope of a better future for their children; their hopes held by ritual and spirituality. The film portrays a tightly knit family in their daily routine of hard work and quiet togetherness at home and in the community, their efforts to break the cycle of poverty, and the intergenerational conflicts within the family.
en.abstract: Husband and wife Htwe Tin e Thein Shwe extract oil from a well near their house. Driven by an engine, cables, and gears, the pumping rig is manually controlled, one

en.plot: "I wish I was invisible so that my presence would stop ruining everything" - a note from the diary of Ton Van Zantvoort, co-director of this documentary, who spent eight years traveling the world. With just a camera, he filmed the most diverse environments, human and natural, with which he found himself interacting. The result is a stream of images, which, telling in a fragmentary and poetic way the impact that mass tourism has on our planet, evokes and addresses themes such as human loneliness, inequalities between North and South, and our relationship with nature and animals.
en.abstract: "I wish I was invisible so that my presence would stop ruining everything" - a note from the diary of Ton Van Zantvoort, co-director of this documentary, who spent eight

en.plot: A journey into the imagery around one of the world's most famous cities, Venice. Tassilo, who lives on the canals of Neu Venedig in southeastern Berlin, was unable to visit the famous italian city because of the Cold War. A young Turkish couple who are about to get married and dream of a honeymoon in Venice find an imitation of it in an Istanbul shopping mall. Bärbel and Nikola get busy creating masks and costumes for a Venetian carnival in southern Germany. A shepherd and a butcher consider themselves true Venetians, yet theirs is not the lagoon city but an eponymous village in the heart of Transylvania. Having fled the war in Bosnia, Marica has found work on the outskirts of a city in a container used as a beauty salon called "Venice".
en.abstract: A journey into the imagery around one of the world's most famous cities, Venice. Tassilo, who lives on the canals of Neu Venedig in southeastern Berlin, was unable to visit

en.plot: A group of experts of international importance isolate themselves for ten days in the New Mexico desert to discuss possible solutions to the contemporary world's most pressing problems. They are all specialists in scientific disciplines concerning the environment, economics, democracy, social media, education, and the technologies inherent in artificial intelligence. Through their knowledge, they want to find a way toward a more optimistic future and develop visions for new paradigms. The film is the official record of this ambitious think tank, which director Pernille Rose Grønkjær had exclusive access to before the world was brought to a standstill by the Sars-Cov-2 pandemic.
en.abstract: A group of experts of international importance isolate themselves for ten days in the New Mexico desert to discuss possible solutions to the contemporary world's most pressing problems. They are

en.plot: In the years following the financial crisis, action on climate change seemed to have slipped to the bottom of the political agenda. Amid reactions to such indifference, the Extinction Rebellion (XR) movement was born in 2018, ready to use the tactic of mass civil disobedience to break the stalemate. Through the documentary, we follow XR co-founders and Farhana Yamin, an international environmental lawyer who played a key role in negotiating the Paris Climate Agreement. Farhana is determined to sound the alarm and get governments to act as they attempt to limit the power of peaceful protest with bills that threaten ten-year prison sentences for those who "cause serious annoyance or inconvenience."
en.abstract: In the years following the financial crisis, action on climate change seemed to have slipped to the bottom of the political agenda. Amid reactions to such indifference, the Extinction Rebellion

en.plot: The story of Sandra, a female orangutan specimen, and the chimpanzee Cecilia, who, imprisoned in abysmal conditions in Argentine zoos, have been regaining their freedom since 2014 thanks to the long legal battle waged by the NGO Proyecto Gran Simio. In order to obtain recognition of the three fundamental rights of every living being - the right to life, to dignity, and to freedom - the group of lawyers the organization relies on will face various obstacles, starting with the hostility of the zoo directors themselves, who are linked to the mafias that hold the illegal wildlife trade. Running parallel in the reconstruction of this affair is photojournalist Candela's investigation of scientific data proving the similarities of humans to apes. But are we ready to break the species barrier?
en.abstract: The story of Sandra, a female orangutan specimen, and the chimpanzee Cecilia, who, imprisoned in abysmal conditions in Argentine zoos, have been regaining their freedom since 2014 thanks to the

en.plot: Despite long years of research, we still don't know exactly how fast Greenland's ice is melting. To answer this question, filmmaker Lars Henrik Ostenfeld follows three of the world's leading glaciologists, Alun Hubbard, Dorthe Dahl-Jensen and Jason Box, on an extreme journey that takes them down to a depth of 180 meters into the largest ice cavities ever discovered by man. All three agree that Greenland is the Earth's thermometer, as the layers of ice that cover it are the key to understanding the scale and speed in sea-level rise: what is happening now in Greenland can help us to understand what will happen to the rest of the world.
en.abstract: Despite long years of research, we still don't know exactly how fast Greenland's ice is melting. To answer this question, filmmaker Lars Henrik Ostenfeld follows three of the world's leading

en.plot: What happens when an ordinary family, living only 300 km from the Arctic Circle, bans all supermarket food from their home for a year? This is the story of the filmmaker Suzanne Crocker, who, despite the skepticism of her three teenage children, the reluctance of her husband, the freezing temperatures of the Canadian Yukon and all the difficulties that come with it, succeeds in her purpose, drawing nourishment only from what can be hunted, fished, grown and harvested. A radical choice that expresses a willingness to seek new horizons for the future and to confront the ability to recover patterns of life abandoned over time. Gradually, the family chronicle extends to the entire community, a valuable opportunity to rediscover its history and identity, made up largely of indigenous people.
en.abstract: What happens when an ordinary family, living only 300 km from the Arctic Circle, bans all supermarket food from their home for a year? This is the story of the

en.internationalTitle: A Distant Thud in The Jungle
en.plot: The highlands in the heart of Papua New Guinea have become a mass tourist destination. Its inhabitants, to cash in on visitors' craving for exoticism, have agreed to wear local costumes and stage the dances of their tradition. At the same time, a much heavier threat looms over this land: the multinational oil company ExxonMobil has gotten its hands on acres of land to start mining for black gold, buying the future of the Huli clan, who reside here, with the promise of money and the mirage of modernity. But the money doesn't seem to want to come, and as time goes on, the scenario becomes increasingly bleak, amid tribal strife, unscrupulous politicians and businessmen, and hordes of tourists who want to capture the essence of a world that has, perhaps, lost all meaning.
en.abstract: The highlands in the heart of Papua New Guinea have become a mass tourist destination. Its inhabitants, to cash in on visitors' craving for exoticism, have agreed to wear local

en.plot: The story of sixty years of underwater photography, which has become, through the lens of marine biologist Tom Goreau, an effective tool to study and protect coral reefs in seas around the world. Inheriting an interest in this extraordinary habitat from his family, Goreau opens, for the first time, the incredible archive that, year after year, first his father and then himself helped create. We are shown, thus, how even these rock formations are now endangered by man's more or less direct interference with their natural environment. A journey that, starting from a dusty Cambridge attic, will take us to the beaches of Jamaica, Bali and the Bikini Atoll, places where, for decades now, Dr. Goreau has been carrying out his studies.
en.abstract: The story of sixty years of underwater photography, which has become, through the lens of marine biologist Tom Goreau, an effective tool to study and protect coral reefs in seas

en.internationalTitle: Allergy Alert: Paranoia in Our Immune System
en.plot: From peanuts to pollen, from cats to dust mites, the rate of allergies is increasing dramatically worldwide. Contact with more or less visible substances, and the intake of potentially harmless foods that are nevertheless increasingly capable of triggering harmful health reactions, lead experts to predict that by 2050 one in two people will have major allergic manifestations. Why does our immune system respond so excessively? To curb it, scientists are studying the interactions between genetics, environmental factors and our modern lifestyles in order to develop revolutionary new approaches to prevention and treatment.
en.abstract: From peanuts to pollen, from cats to dust mites, the rate of allergies is increasing dramatically worldwide. Contact with more or less visible substances, and the intake of potentially harmless

en.plot: Zio Riz is the name of the Canadian canoe on which a man descends the waters of the Volturno River, starting from the source of Rocchetta al Volturno, an unspoiled natural paradise. This Charon slowly takes us from the natural harmony of that protected oasis further and further down the river to its mouth in the town of Castel Volturno, a real metropolitan hell. The passing of the seasons is suggested by the rain, the melting snow, the continuous flow of water until the soil dries out, lashed by the midday sun. Along the way, life unfolds in its daily march, from the cries of animals and the sounds of insects to the noise of man's labor, from the repetitive sounds of farm machinery and transportation to the increasingly chaotic sounds of the urban environment.
en.abstract: Zio Riz is the name of the Canadian canoe on which a man descends the waters of the Volturno River, starting from the source of Rocchetta al Volturno, an unspoiled

en.plot: The story of the transition from heavy industry, which characterized production in the 19th and 20th centuries, to logistics managed by digital systems, seen through the history of the Ferriera: Trieste's famous steel plant, closed after 123 years and numerous changes of ownership. Because of its role in the local economy and society, the factory in the Julian capital is a symbol, but not a unique example. Bytes, containers, white collars and silence replace fire, dust, sweat and crashes, telling us not only about an urban transformation leading toward sustainability and the conversion of metallurgy into clean energy, but also about social changes related to the effort to adapt contexts to new, cleaner though perhaps more anonymous forms of production.

en.plot: Mount Cervino rises imposingly among the surrounding peaks dominating Breuil-Cervinia in Italy and Zermatt in Switzerland, two renowned tourist destinations divided by mountains, but always united by winter sports enthusiasts and professionals. In 2020, however, in the aftermath of the Covid-19 pandemic, the balance shatters, making these neighboring places the example of a surreal new normality that determines opposite fates just a few meters away.
en.abstract: Mount Cervino rises imposingly among the surrounding peaks dominating Breuil-Cervinia in Italy and Zermatt in Switzerland, two renowned tourist destinations divided by mountains, but always united by winter sports enthusiasts

en.plot: The theatrical path held at the De Gasperi - Battaglia High School in Norcia recounts the dramatic experience of living in places where the earth trembles: places of great architectural, scenic and natural beauty, periodically shaken by seismic tremors. The text stems from WhatsApp chats used by students during the tragic days of the last earthquake. Messages that punctuate their fragilities and their experience; a strong and unpredictable poetic time, which turned the evanescence of the erapid and synthetic communication of social media into a creative dimension of community theater and cinema.

en.plot: The intermittent sound of cicadas, the sound of wind, rain and burning fire, the sea: suggestions of a complex landscape that appears as if in constant becoming and, at the same time, in a suspended dimension. In the remote Sicilian countryside, the sudden change in the weather marks the end of a ripe summer. A group of horses is shrouded in darkness, smoke from a distant fire spreads, while the loneliness of a young shepherd in an old farmhouse awaits news of the birth of a distant daughter.

en.plot: In Prato, the recycling of wool clothing and its regeneration into fiber is an ancient and shared experience. Not only this practice is a precursor of the contemporary techniques drawing on the concept of sustainability and circularity, but it also has been able to create wealth in the area from what others throw away. The so-called "rags" are an inexhaustible resource and are the starting point of this journey around the world, discovering the impact on the Planet of excessive consumerism and the consequent practice of disposability typical of Fast Fashion. Thanks to expert testimony, aspects of a very serious environmental problem are highlighted, which, however, if addressed correctly by producers, consumers and governments, could represent a genuine opportunity towards a new scenario of economically sustainable fashion.
en.abstract: In Prato, the recycling of wool clothing and its regeneration into fiber is an ancient and shared experience. Not only this practice is a precursor of the contemporary techniques drawing

en.plot: Intensive farms are places far from population centers, barely recognizable from some country back road or along the highway. Even if we do not see them, they are aplenty and not always accessible. The film allows us to enter them, slowly and firsthand, through the gaze of a camera hidden between the buttons of a jacket. The boy wearing it is there on an undercover investigation, but, nonetheless, his encounter with the animals will lead him to make an unexpected choice.
en.abstract: Intensive farms are places far from population centers, barely recognizable from some country back road or along the highway. Even if we do not see them, they are aplenty and

en.plot: In alpine forests, the effects of climate change on ecosystems are more evident than in other environments. That is why scientist Giorgio Vacchiano, a forest management expert, decides to take a break from the university and return to the forests of his childhood, in the Aosta Valley, where his passion for plants was born. Thus begins a journey that leads him to retrace that territory and meet other researchers and scientists, driven by the need to understand the profound changes taking place. Giorgio's research has an urgent and fundamental purpose: to work out strategies to intervene to save the forest and help it preserve all those benefits it offers humans, ensuring their survival on this planet.

en.plot: The small mountain community of Intermesoli, in the province of Termoli, is slowly disappearing. Young Simone, tacit heir to memories and ancient traditions, takes on the responsibilities of the village, amid hesitation and new awareness. Not far away lives Filippo, who, in a kind of spiritual and mental hermitage, moves further and further away from the community, trying to rebuild himself and his faith. Both of them, subtly bound by oppressive silences, come to terms with inner limits and compromises, under the watchful gaze of a population that unwittingly overwhelms their lives and destinies.
en.abstract: The small mountain community of Intermesoli, in the province of Termoli, is slowly disappearing. Young Simone, tacit heir to memories and ancient traditions, takes on the responsibilities of the village,

en.plot:
In South Tyrol, where tradition and innovation go hand in hand, six years ago Lorenz and Leander decided to start a new business: growing and marketing herbs. At the same time Alexander, with his own family, lives off the cheeses produced by just twelve cows, while Katya and Armin, make artisanal chocolate and Maria runs the restaurant that has belonged to her family since the 1800s. Between enthusiasm and hardship, minimal goals and lofty ambitions, these small producers recount their daily challenges in a food market dominated by large retailers. A complex picture that lies behind realities usually described as the flagship of Italian gastronomy and an example of a sustainable and successful production model.

Produced in collaboration with Rai Alto Adige, IDM Südtirol.

en.plot: Turin is the first city in the world to have a part of metropolitan territory recognized among the Biosphere Reserves, an international qualification awarded by UNESCO under the Man and Biosphere MAB program for the conservation and protection of the landscape, its habitats and ecosystems. This is the Po Hill Reserve, a unique territory for its environmental richness in the vicinity of an urban center, covering 1700 square kilometers around the small town of San Raffaele Cimena. A place where sustainable cultivation, such as that of rice, is part of history, restoring Nature's ability to mark time.
en.abstract: Turin is the first city in the world to have a part of metropolitan territory recognized among the Biosphere Reserves, an international qualification awarded by UNESCO under the Man and

en.plot: A journey through the lobby of the "material of the century", the big corporate interests, and the contemporary environmental havoc. A look into an economic system that promotes the deception of greenwashing and in which the culture of waste reigns, with 396 million tons of virgin plastic produced on a global scale each year and a profit of 840 billion euros in the European market and for its allied industries alone. From the institutional corridors of Brussels, where regulatory battles are increasingly heated, we come to Italy to the plastic beach of Castel Volturno and to those lands wounded by pollution, captured for years by the Campania-based photographer Giovanni Izzo, who has dedicated his life to fighting environmental and human degradation through the art of his works.
en.abstract: A journey through the lobby of the "material of the century", the big corporate interests, and the contemporary environmental havoc. A look into an economic system that promotes the deception

en.plot: "Keep Clean and Run" is a project designed by Roberto Cavallo together with A.I.C.A. International Association for Environmental Communication, which involves combining running with waste collection through a sporting activity called plogging. Thanks to this initiative, 15,000 people have been actively involved and nearly 250 tons of waste has been collected in our country since 2015. Roberto runs all over Italy, from North to South, bringing a strong message and reflection on what footprints humans leave on the Planet. For this latest edition, documented by director Zicchetti, he draws inspiration from the photos and recordings of his grandfather Remigio: he retraces the places of the Great War, encounters their memory, and rediscovers the deep sense of the union between the values of Ecology and Peace.
en.abstract: "Keep Clean and Run" is a project designed by Roberto Cavallo together with A.I.C.A. International Association for Environmental Communication, which involves combining running with waste collection through a sporting activity

en.plot: In the 1960s, in Piadena, in the province of Cremona, Giuseppe Morandi photographed and filmed the last rites of the so-called paisan, laborers and agricultural wage earners of the Lower Po Valley. Together with Gianfranco Micio Azzali, a bergamino, that is, a dairy cow breeder, in the same period he founded the Piadena Culture League, with the aim of collecting testimonies and preserving the memory of this community of workers. Thanks to this heritage and the contribution of the SOMS 1908 Mutual Aid Society of Torre De' Picenardi, together with the Mantuan eQual Association, the stories of the paisan come back to life in the places that once saw them as protagonists and as an example, today, of affirmation of their own class identity and cultural resistance.

en.plot: Val Visdende, an alpine valley located in Comelico (Belluno), was deeply impacted by the storm "Vaia," which hit northeastern Italy at the end of October 2018. Today, some inhabitants and visitors tell us about the gradual rebirth of these extraordinary forested areas, revealing the fragility of a fascinating territory that, despite the difficulties, resists and teaches us the sense of the limit.

en.plot:
The life of the wild orchid depends on its relationship with soil fungi, pollinating insects, humans and more. Therefore, this plant can also be considered a key bioindicator of the health of the Planet.

Inspired by the European program "LIFEorchids," in collaboration with the University of Turin, CNR - Institute for the Protection of Sustainable Plants, Plant Fascination Day and the University of Genoa, the short film is the first episode of "Particles Planet," an experimental art-science project whose goal is to share scientific knowledge in a different way.
